intro: Gypsophila paniculata var. adenopoda, commonly known as the腺花草, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, branched inflorescences composed of numerous small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
